_header: Before thou pretend any evil in thy heart
Note:
Ringler Jr. (1992)
XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler , TM 250.
Subjects: advice, moral; death, approach of; mortality
_description: Remember the end, ‘quod Carter’ — one couplet

DULCosViii9.Transcription:
Be fore thou pretend any will in thyn harteRemembre the end when thou
                    shalt departe
DULCosViii9.Note:
Added to left margin sideways, bottom to top, by same hand as 4146, 4957, 5226, 4897; but not same hand as 3010, 5708, 4131 in same MS; elsewhere author identified as Thomas
                    Carter.
